entry.title: Hong-Konger Arrested For Disrespecting National Anthem #hongkong #china Here in the US, if you don’t respect the national anthem the worst that is going to happen is you’re going to kill your football career due to faux-outrage. But in Hong Kong? Straigh
entry.content: Hong-Konger Arrested For Disrespecting National Anthem #hongkong #china Here in the US, if you don’t respect the national anthem the worst that is going to happen is you’re going to kill your football career due to faux-outrage. But in Hong Kong? Straight to jail. Chung Wing-chun just found that out after he just became the first person tried under the city’s controversial National Anthem law. Right, what Chung did was edit a video of a Hong Kong Olympic Fencer during the Tokyo Olympics awards ceremony by replacing the Chinese national anthem with the song “Glory to Hong Kong,” Which became a major protest anthem during the massive 2018-2019 protests. Many think what Chung did wasn’t even disrespectful at all, and he continues to claim that he never meant it as disrespect.| [] However, the court magistrate said that “This behavior clearly undermines the dignity of the national anthem as a symbol and sign of the People’s Republic of China.” The 27-year-old man won’t find out his sentence until July 20th, but this conviction carries upwards of three years in prison and an over $6,000 fine. [] It’s bad enough that a law like this even exists, Like sure, if people want to be so patriotic that disrespecting your country’s national anthem can kill a career then let them be. It’s stupid, but on a completely different level to actually having the government potentially throw you in prison for it.
